name: Amy Bornstein
text:
I am a Artist, once a canvas has sold, it must be crated and shipped. The Owner by the name of Angeline and her staff are very helpful, patient, quick and very professional.
I will be using them constantly from now on.
It’s peace of mind to know that my artwork will travel to its new home and arrive in perfect condition.
Thank you, MailPro!!👩‍🎨

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! Always a pleasure to help our artists get their gorgeous art to where it's going!

name: Missy Fantusi
text: Nice greeting cards, last time I was there, I was waited on right away. That's great!!

name: Marsha Reynolds
text: Most convenient mailing store I have ever been to. I am never going back to the post office. The service at MailPro is outstanding and the staff is extremely helpful and lovely. Will definitely be back again and again.

resp.text: Ooooh thank you for the 5 stars! And thank you for letting us help you! Always a pleasure to be of service to sweet folks like you!

name: Steve Middlebrooks
text: I went in to ship a golf club today at Mail pro in Owens crossroads Alabama. There was a lady in front of me that went in no mask on and the lady at the counter told her just to put her package over there. I came in with no mask on she told me to go back out and get a mask! Does she know the time it takes for Covid-19 to spread is it a short time or a long time? Apparently she works for the CDC and she knows all about it to discriminate against who wears a mask and who does not. If that service wasn't bad enough they charged me $51 to ship a golf club which normally would cost $39 anywhere else. Save your money save your time and save your humiliation Don't go here.

resp.text:
Wow. Yes, two customers in a row walked right past our “masks required” sign that is posted on the door. The lady ahead of you could drop her prepaid off and go, you needed to be in the store longer. It would have been futile for her leave to get her mask and come back in - her task was complete.

I’m sorry you feel humiliated by being asked to be compassionate to those around us that haven’t had their vaccination yet. We are still trying to follow the current CDC guidelines, they are on the CDC website if you need a refresher.

And again, I’m sorry you felt the price to pack and ship your golf club was more than you wanted to pay. Generally the price for clubs to be packed and shipped runs between $25-$35. The weight, dimensions and destination for this particular package determined the options we gave you. We would have gladly handed it back to you if you had wanted, so you could “price shop” and maybe find an option that better suited your price range.

As always, you are welcome in our store in the future provided you can be considerate and compassionate to the other shoppers.

name: Kim Ringenbach (looneypumpkin)
text: Mail Pro is the best place to ship from in Huntsville! The staff is super friendly and quick! I've never had an issue and the owner is the best!

name: Garel 2008
text:
My wife sent an international mail to the Philippines with very important papers and very expensive. She had the wrong address on the package. She found out when she returned home, called them and they went through all the outgoing mail and found it and changed the address label in time. Great job! We will use MailPro again and with a great level of confidence.

Thanks! MailPro

resp.text: Aw! Thank you for the great review! Always happy to help, glad to get a package where it's supposed to go! Thanks for coming to see us!

My employees live over the mountain and I made the decision to remain closed today at 6:30 this morning when the news was reporting that schools, redstone and colleges were closed.

text: Fantastic business! I have shipped dozens of packages through them. Everything from legal papers to expensive fragile music instruments, and they have packaged and shipped everything perfectly. Love how convenient they are.

name: Tee West
text: Would give minus 5 stars if possible. Owner very rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A  package was processed couple months ago to Amazon from different person in store Today owner refused and said they DID NOT do the package before when in fact it was. Owner needs to learn how to actually run this store sufficiently. I'd been embarrassed to admit I was owner with that attitude. I just read your reply and trust me you were rude and have no intentions of ever doing service here again. That shows bad character on your part for reply such as that!!!!!!! What an arrogance!!!

resp.text:
LOL!! Yes, I had the audacity to disagree with you... I'm sorry, you are simply mistaken. You chose the Amazon QR code that clearly states on your return for you to take the QR to branded UPS Store for them to scan.

We are MailPro, a UPS Authorized Shipping Outlet and can take Amazon returns with a UPS label when you choose "UPS Dropoff", our scanners can't scan UPS Store QR codes.

Last time I'm sure we showed you how to cancel your return, and re-return it as a "UPS Dropoff" to process it for you. We do this approximately 20 times a day for all of our fabulous customers.

I tried to show you how change your return but you were not receptive, choosing instead to be offended. Next time when you bring your QR code in - we'll be sure to walk you through each step so you can understand the process. Life is too short to go through it looking to be offended..

text: Great service and convenient location for mailing packages and returns to Amazon.

resp.text: Aw thanks! It's a pleasure to help!

text: Fast, friendly, helpful - LOVE MailPro! I always bypass the Post Office for the ease and convenience of this local mailing center. They are the nicest and can't beat their amazing service!

name: Lacey House

I Definitely recommend this business for all your shipping, binding, and packaging needs! Their location is also very convenient! Thanks MailPro!

resp.text: Thank you! Your business is very much appreciated and please come again soon!

name: Richard McCollum
text: They lost a FedEx package we sent. It has been a huge inconvenience for lots of people (and will continue to be for awhile). MailPro claims FedEx lost the package, but FedEx never scanned the package saying they picked it up, which leads me to believe MailPro lost it. FedEx claims MailPro lost it. Either way I really don't care, huge pain, never using the company again even though they are convenient.

resp.text: We are terribly sorry for your inconvenience. Your package did get picked up by FedEx, and we do have the manifest that the driver signed. It is rare that a package doesn't get scanned at the hub, but it does happen. We are sorry it happened to your package. All we can do is reimburse you for your shipping charge, which we have done.

name: Rebecca Jensen
text:
I was in Mailpro yesterday. The lady with dark hair and bigger was ugly to me in front of customers. I was there before the lady she was waiting on and asked her a question. That’s when she got mad and said she was waiting on someone else. I then said that I was there first and she went off on me even pointing out that I had crossed the line when I parked. She gave me the email I needed to send my package with and really though t I would send package thru her after her behavior. I paid 11 cents and left. I will never go in that horrible store again.

Your negative reply truly reflects the attitude you had toward me. Most reputable businesses try to correct the problem or apologize. They do not retaliate or make snarky comments.

resp.text:
Every customer is important and appreciated in our store. But we do expect our customers to act with basic manners learned in kindergarten. You did enter the store first and began your Wayfair return on your phone at the counter. While you were being helped by Wayfair I began helping a customer that came in and was ready.

You interrupted this transaction to tell me to look for the Wayfair email. I explained to you that I was helping another customer and I would help you as soon as her transaction was completed. You said "But I was here first!" And I replied "But you weren't ready." I was not unkind to you, I was not rude. I also mentioned that had parked diagonally in two spaces - to which you replied "I've got a new car..." Wow.

I see you have sent four packages through us in the last two years. If you want to take you business elsewhere, that's your choice. Of course, you are still welcome continue to drop off your prepaid returns with us in the future.

name: Robert Lee
text: I'm literally in here all the time shipping random items or sending certified mail. The service is always great. Thanks for being awesome! I'm sure I'll see you sometime today to ship something else!

resp.text: Thank you! We strive to be of service, and appreciate your business!

name: CurlyCutie
text: My daughter and I just experienced the most horrendous display of racism and bigotry from the "owner" of this location that I have yet to encounter in this area.  I own a small business that I run out of my home in McMullen Cove (and yes, I do have a license with the City of Huntsville).  I mail packages on a daily basis.  Today, I missed my mail pick up and our local post office had already closed so we drove down to this store so that we could ensure our packages would go out today.  My 12 year old went in first and was refused service.  So, I then took the packages and went inside only to be told that, "I don't receive anything from the Post Office for compensation and am not required to provide service to you."   I asked for her to put that in writing, she refused, spewed some other nastiness until 2 other individuals came in and I told her I would be reporting her to the proper authorities and I left.   As I type this, I am still shaken, that this kind of bigotry and hatred can still exist.  That people feel they have the right to treat others with such vile.  I will not be returning to this location ever and would strongly urge others to also find somewhere else to spend your hard earned money.

resp.text: Wow, I feel I have to respond to this - this goes beyond misleading and is simply a lie. There were others in the store that were witness to your extremely rude, and bullying behavior Saturday afternoon. I'm so sorry that we couldn't help you, and that you were not happy here. We really try hard to make every customers experience here a very good one. As I explained to you when you were here - your postal labels would not scan. I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

text: Went for help with a difficult Amazon return, & the very helpful staff worked with me to return the packages with no charge! Angeline was especially kind. Will be returning.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

There were others in the store that were witness to your extremely rude, and bullying behavior Saturday afternoon. I'm so sorry that we couldn't help you, and that you were not happy here. We really try hard to make every customers experience here a very good one. As I explained to you when you were here - your postal labels would not scan. I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

Extremely bad experience will never use again and I don't recommend anyone use them. I shipped the same 3 sized packages threw USPS for only $13.84.

resp.text:
We are not UPS.  We are a ship center and have no control over UPS rates.
UPS charges for the size of the box and its weight.  The post office will be less expensive most of the time and we frequently explain this to our patrons.  Understand again - we have no  control over the fees charged by UPS.  We are not a UPS store (they do have flexibility) we are just a local authorized ship center.  The person who waited on you was my Mother-in-law who was in some pain and overall not well.  Perhaps if you visit our location again I will be in the office and delighted to work with you.  I assure you Robbie Patterson is the nicest and most friendly person you would ever meet under normal circumstances.  We are sorry you had a bad experience.

text: I went there to return a package from a company I purchased an item from.  I was instructed to take the pack there and they would print a label and send it back to the company that sent it. The employee told me she wished their customer service would stop sending people out there with that information.  I ended up having to drive all the way from Irondale to downtown Birmingham.  I am posting this so everyone knows.  You can go to Irondale to pickup a package but sending an unlabeled package can't be handled at that location.  My package was taken care of quickly and professionally at the FedEx store on 20th street Birmingham. I was unable to print a label because I don't have wifi or a computer in my home.  I would normally take care of this by going to the public library but my local library is closed because of the virus.

text: I was told my package was delivered and left on porch. When I got home the package was not there. I have security cameras so if you come into my yard you are on camera and 2 if you come down the driveway. They were never there and didn't deliver the package. I called several times and was told that the package was left at the address. Two days of calling trying to get someone to show me that the package was scanned at my house and while on the phone with an employee for FedEx a delivery truck pulls into the yard and drops off the package. During this time the representative I'm on the phone with keeps insisting that it was delivered on the day it was suppose to have been and there is no way a mistake could have been made. I tell him that the package is being dropped off now and he hung up the phone. Never received an apology or explanation as to where it was really delivered but it is really aggravating to know that if a mistake is made that they will not admit it or know where it actually is delivered. I understand mistakes happen and could understand if they would just have said that they made one and tried to assist in locating it. I will never use them again after this.

text: still waiting on my lawn mower to be delivered by this company. They called me on Monday, no fault of the driver, to let me know that when it was loaded they didn't put it on a pallet and the driver had no way to unload it, he stated he had reached out to the terminal with no response. Since, he didnt' want to mess up my lawn mower, he asked me if I could call the reschedule the delivery. When I called, I got a gentleman who said well who forgot to put a pallet under it, sir idk, I don't work for you guys. He said you don't have a man at home that can just take it off off the truck, I said no sir, don't know any man strong enough to unload a  zero turn lawn mower in a crate by himself. He goes and you don't have a fork lift, again no sir, don't have one of those lying around either. He goes well guess I don't have a choice but to bring it back in and put a pallet under it, this is just rediculous. I am sorry to be a bother, but it is now day two of it suppose to be delivered and I still have no lawn mower and no contact from this company. I had to pay freight and they wanted me to do the work to unload their mistake. I called the company and was advised that my lawn mower was sitting waiting to be re loaded, but they couldn't tell me when this might happen or when it would be delivered. I don't want a phone call from this company to just give me more excuses or ask me if I could that fork lift or hulk of a man to do their job. I just want my lawn mower and then I will make sure to NOT ever have to deal with this company again. Learn some customer service and don't get mad when you guys don't do your job.

name: Alexa Womack
text: Such a welcoming store! I was greeted by every person in the store upon entering and leaving. They were even willing to get my package ready to go even though it was UPS. I was only there for a few minutes but I really felt that the employees enjoyed their job! Definitely recommend using them.

name: Brian Moran
text: I have to say that I've never been taken care of in the way this team takes care of my needs. As a small business person myself, I appreciate the attention to detail, warm environment, and sincerity I receive when I walk into with The Shipping Store. I've read some of the other reviews and I would have to say that their prices are very fair. They provide a service that I have not seen matched with other big company chain stores. It is an absolute pleasure to do business with these guys!

name: Sandra Austin
text: Anytime I mail from here it takes many days for the package to get anywhere.

name: Christina Morse
text: The employees at The Shipping Store were super friendly and helpful! They did everything they could to save me money on shipping. If you have anything to ship, I would definitely recommend The Shipping Store. They made shipping a breeze!

name: Jennifer Melcher
text: We took in a fragile item and they packed it for us wonderfully. They were super nice and not just to us but to everyone that came in. They also showed us ways they could help our small business save money on shipping and printing. We will definitely use again!

name: John Wallace
text: They do not ship fedex, waste of my, yours and everyone's time.  Fedex sign in window, rude lady behind the counter..DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU ARE TRYING TK SHIP A FEDEX PACKAGE, FALSE ADVERTISEMENT..!!!!!

name: jose villa
text: Waste of time they say they ship fedex but they don't they are limited so you have to go to the one in Madison. Why even call it the ship in store where they can't ship nothing

name: susan hassett
text: I have used The Shipping Store for many years to mail packages, have copies made and faxes sent. I appreciate the professional and friendly staff. Their packaging services help me save time and enable me to send packages hassle-free.

name: Tracy Roberson
text: The staff are always professional and courteous when I bring things in to have shipped.  I wish the same was true of USPS. The Shipping Store has never lost any of my parcels with the many dealings I have had with the business. You can probably guess who has. I will continue to bring my business here as long as they are here. Thank you.

name: Jenna Burfield
text:
Store staff was very rude. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I brought in a package to be shipped and asked for documentation stating that I dropped a the package off. The lady behind the counter stated that if I wanted a receipt that I could wait until FedEx picked it from their location and scanned the barcode (who is to say they wouldn't loose my package) or I could drive to Madison.

Edited to inform that I was able to take my package to Walgreens for drop off. The Walgreens staff were friendly and promptly emailed me a recept for my records. THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for the pushback I received when I asked for a simple drop off receipt from The Shipping Store.

name: Mary McMahan
text: Amanda saved me from losing my $4900.00 ring to a scammer on Craigslist.  I am so grateful to her and to this store for hiring her.  This experience has brought renewed faith that there are still people who work for businesses that genuinely care about their customers !!  Amanda, you are an angel, I will always be grateful for you and I pray blessings upon you and your family !!  The Shipping Store....don't ever let her go !!!!!

name: Laron Hardy
text: Great people, great service!  The Shipping Store is a place where you will be taken care of.  Great folks!

name: AK Lee
text: They offer a great service and and I even paid for the tape it was worth it

name: L D
text: Way overpriced. $0.75/each for stamps! Their shipping costs are also astronomical. I went there to ship a package and was quoted an amount so high that I thought it was a joke. It wasn't. I then went to Staples right down the street to get a quote from their shipping center and it was 50% less. Stay away from this place!

resp.text:
Jill,

Firstly, thank you for patronizing our business.  We take great pride in our friendly, high level of customer service.  As to your comments about our service charges,  If we weren't able to realize some level of margin over our costs, we would not be able to maintain a viable business or be able to offer the level of service that we so pride ourselves in.

Thanks sincerely,
Don Cantrell
The Shipping Store and more...

name: cassandra chittam
text: Closest shipping place to our company.  We will be driving the extra distance to find an actual post office from now on.  Pricing is extremely high to send out items USPS.  When I called asking why they charged my assistant 10.74 for a small FLAT RATE box, I was told they do not honer flat rate shipping.  I then asked why did they not inform my assistant of this and they stated because all she said was she needed to ship these items. The lady behind the counter didn't know what she was doing.  First time she rang up the bill the total came to $4000 for USPS shipping. Wanting to use USPS services for your packages stay away from this place unless you want to pay double what you would if you went to the post office.

resp.text:
Ms. Chittam,
Firstly thank you for patronizing our store.  We take great pride in deliverying friendly, high quality goods and services.  As to your comments about USPS flat rate boxes, we do not offer them as they simply aren't big enough for average small shipments.   Per your comment about the cash register misring, we are sorry but we as humans are not infallable.  Fortunately, our system will catch any errors before the transaction is complete.  We apologize for the momentary delay.   Regarding your comment that our USPS prices are double the Post Office,  yes, we do charge a nominal service charge to cover our overhead and the ability to maintain a viable business thereby offering our customers a level of service they might not realize at the Post Office.    In fact many of our USPS prices are actually lower than the Post Office as we realize volume discounts that an individual would be unable to quality for.

Thank you again for your comments.
Sincerely,
Don Cantrell
President,
The Shipping Store and more...

name: Daryl Piner
text: Excellent service and very friendly people who will go the extra mile to help you.  I reccomend this place to everyone.

name: Lee Bates
text: Always friendly service and they do the job right. I drive extra miles for this quality.

name: Elise van zandt
text: A+++ service! Very friendly staff and super helpful!

name: Rodrigo Banzon
text: Excellent service.  Outstanding staff!

resp.text: Thank you. We take great pride in our level and quality of service.

name: Brenda Caudle
text: Fast and friendly service. The cost was higher than expected.

name: Misty Myres
text: Very rude staff. I called ahead to verify all details and was told something different when I got there leaving me to rush to FedEx in Madison to ship my packages.

resp.text:
Ms. Myres,
Firstly, thank you for patronizing our business.  We pride ourselves in deliverying friendly,  high quality goods and services.  However, we are unable to access your or any other customers FedEx account number to charge shipping to.  We gladly accept FedEx prepaid packages at no charge, which have the shipping label already affixed.  Otherwise we are glad to create a label for you for which there would be a charge.

Respectfully,
Don Cantrell
The Shipping Store and more...

name: Karla Gibson
text: People were Very nice and helpful.  Thank you!

name: John Buckelew
text: I use them for my mailbox, shipping, and FAX service. Professional in every way. Very friendly.

name: Jim Nichols
text: Its like when Butch said to Sundance, "Who ARE those guys?"

name: Rodney Scott
text: Had a legal document that had to be handled asap and the store more than exceeded.

name: Teresa Hutto
text: They are great people!!!

name: Linda Brandon

text: Kept transferring me to other departments that they said would be able to help me but never could. People I spoke to all gave me conflicting information.

name: Ray Boykin

text: Another ups, it is horrible too

text: Great place to drop of UPS pagages sold on mecari!

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.
